H0.text: Torque is considered to be the rotational version of force in physics.

H1.text: Work is the rotational version of force in physics.

H2.text: Energy is considered to be the rotational version of force in physics.

H3.text: Pressure is considered to be the rotational version of force in physics.

A4.text: The moment of force, often called torque, is the product of a force on an object and the distance from the reference point to the object.
